title: Bangladesh Cricketers Go On Indefinite Strike To Put T20 Series Against India In Jeopardy

Bangladesh Cricketers Go On Indefinite Strike To Put T20 Series Against India In Jeopardy

Bangladesh Cricketers Go On Indefinite Strike To Put T20 Series Against India In Jeopardy

Bangladesh cricketers have gone on indefinite strike putting in doubt the upcoming series against India which starts in November 3.

AFP The group led by senior players Shakib Al Hasan and Mushfiqur Rahim, announced that they will take no part in cricketing activity until their demands regarding the development of the sport are met.

The players have put forward 11 demands, and want the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) to accept and implement them, failing which the players will continue to boycott.

AP

The consequences could be huge if the issues isn’t resolved, and it will also impact the upcoming series against India which takes place at the beginning of next month.

According to Cricbuzz, some of the demands include, having more domestic tournaments; a cricket calendar for domestic cricket so that players can prepare better; and also increase in the numbers of players on the central contract list.

There has been no response from the BCB yet, but it looks like it might tumble on for a bit.

The tour of India might be the casualty if the board doesn’t give into the demands of the players.
